revisions.rev:
{{Unreferenced|date=August 2010}} The '''1913 Copa del Rey''' were two different competitions held the same year. Due to disagreements between the [[Royal Spanish Football Federation]] and some clubs, in 1913 two parallel competitions were held: an "official", organized by the [[Royal Spanish Football Federation|FEF]] (in [[Madrid]]) and an "unofficial", organized by the Spanish Union Football Club (in [[Barcelona]]). Both are currently recognized as official by the RFEF. ==Copa FEF== {{Infobox football tournament season | title = Copa FEF | year = 1913 | other_title = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | country = Spain | num_teams = 5 | defending champions = | champions = [[Real UniÃ³n|Racing de IrÃºn]] | runner-up = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | matches = 5 | goals = 10 | top goal scorer = | player = | prevseason = [[1912 Copa del Rey|1912]] | nextseason = [[1914 Copa del Rey|1914]] }} The competition started on March 16, 1913 and concluded on March 23, 1913 with the Final, held at the [[Estadio de O'Donell|O'Donell]], [[Madrid]], in which [[Real UniÃ³n|Racing de IrÃºn]] lifted the trophy for the first time ever with a 1-0 victory over [[Athletic Bilbao]]. ===Preliminary Round=== {{footballbox | date = March 16, 1913 | team1 = [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a FC]] | score = 1–0 | team2 = [[Real Vigo Sporting|Vigo FC]] | stadium = [[Estadio O'Donnell]], [[Madrid]] }} ===Semifinals=== {{footballbox | date = March 17, 1913 | team1 = [[Athletic Bilbao]] | score = 3–0 | team2 = [[Real Madrid|Madrid FC]] | stadium = [[Estadio O'Donnell]], [[Madrid]] }} {{footballbox | date = March 18, 1913 | team1 = [[Real UniÃ³n|Racing de IrÃºn]] | score = 1–0 | team2 = [[FC Espanya de Barcelona|EspaÃ±a FC]] | stadium = [[Estadio O'Donnell]], [[Madrid]] }} ===Final=== {{main|1913 FEF Copa del Rey Final}} {{footballbox | date = March 22, 1913 | team1 = [[Real UniÃ³n|Racing de IrÃºn]] | score = 2–2
([[Extra time|a.e.t.]]) | team2 = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | goals1 = Patricio {{goal}}
Retegui {{goal}} | goals2 = {{goal}} Pichichi
{{goal}} Belauste II | stadium = [[Estadio O'Donnell]], [[Madrid]] | referee = RodrÃ­guez }} ===Replay=== {{footballbox | date = March 23, 1913 | time = 15:30 ([[European Summer Time|EST]]) | team1 = [[Real UniÃ³n|Racing de IrÃºn]] | score = 1–0 | team2 = [[Athletic de Bilbao]] | goals1 = Retegui {{goal}} | stadium = [[Estadio O'Donnell]], [[Madrid]] | referee = Manuel Prast }} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center; margin: 0 auto;" |- ![[Copa del Rey]] 1913 winners |- |'''[[Real UniÃ³n|Racing de IrÃºn]]'''
'''1st title''' |} ==Copa UECF== {{Infobox football tournament season | title = Copa UEFC | year = 1913 | other_title = | image = | imagesize = | caption = | country = Spain | num_teams = 3 | defending champions = | champions = [[FC Barcelona]] | runner-up = [[Real Sociedad]] | matches = 3 | goals = 7 | top goal scorer = | player = | prevseason = [[1912 Copa del Rey|1912]] | nextseason = [[1914 Copa del Rey|1914]] }} Three teams were going to take part in the tournament, but Pontevedra CF withdrew before the start of the tournament. ===Final=== {{main|1913 UECF Copa del Rey Final}} ====First leg==== {{footballbox | date = March 16, 1913 | team2 = [[FC Barcelona]] | score = 2–2 | team1 = [[Real Sociedad]] | goals1 = Arrillaga {{goal}}
Artola {{goal|89}} | goals2 = {{goal}} Forns
